lexUnit.name: school.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large group of fish or sea mammals, or a group of people sharing similar ideas, methods, or style.

sentence.text: It is only the second time this century that a school of sperm whales has been seen in the waters around Orkney .
Schools of porpoise , dolphin and sometimes even turtles can also be seen but we were n't so lucky that day .
The sound of his music attracted a school of dolphins , whereupon Arion leapt overboard and was carried safely to shore on the back of one of the dolphins .
His last song attracted a school of dolphins , one of which ferried Arion on his back all the way to Corinth .
The tuna fish swim beneath schools of dolphins , fishermen do not discriminate and scoop up the whole lot in their nets .

Once dolphins locate a school of fish , they spread out , some individuals diving down to the school of prey to herd it to the surface by swimming around and under the fish in an ever-tightening formation .
The swordfish , like the sailfish , will follow a school of fish for a considerable distance before it decides to attack .

We floated there , hardly breathing through our snorkels , watching small schools of transparent , leaf-like fish -- which we assumed no ichthyologist had previously seen or named -- but there was no sign of an eel .
This was a school of monster fish , hungrily alive .

The perch 's efforts are often disrupted though , by an invasion he is powerless to repel -- mass spawning schools of up to 20 minnows Pungtungia herzi can descend on his territory , lay their eggs alongside his , and then depart .

During the May to August breeding season , she found that three quarters of perch nests along a 150-metre-long stretch of the stream were parasitised by schools of minnows ; during the same period , she only once saw a minnow laying its eggs away from a perch nest .

Taking advantage of the diversion created by the school of minnows laying their eggs , this predatory fish would enter stage right and gobble up the perch 's eggs while he was desperately trying to evict the minnows .
In this area , schools of large yellowfin tuna often swim underneath groups of oceanic dolphins .
Fishermen have long known of the association , and have traditionally used the presence of dolphins as a cue to finding schools of tuna .
LaBudde filmed entire schools of tuna trapped in the nets : ` ... the collective mass of their bodies temporarily pulling entire sections of net far below the surface .
